Administration.label: Administration
Administration.description: The Administration Building, with its distinctive bell towers, was the first structure built on the campus. The facility houses administrative offices for the university and for the Texas Tech University System.

Administrative_Support_Center.label: Administrative Support Center
Administrative_Support_Center.description: This facility houses Transportation & Parking Services, IT Help Central, and the MailTech postal operation.

Agricultural_Education.label: Agricultural Education
Agricultural_Education.description: The building houses the Department of Agricultural Education and Communications which offers undergraduate and graduate degrees.

Agricultural_Pavilion.label: Agricultural Pavilion
Agricultural_Pavilion.description: The building is home to offices, labs and classrooms for the Departments of Landscape Architecture and Range & Wildlife Management.

Agricultural_Sciences.label: Agricultural Sciences
Agricultural_Sciences.description: The building is home to offices and classrooms for the College of Agricultural Sciences and Natural Resources.

Animal_&_Food_Sciences.label: Animal & Food Sciences
Animal_&_Food_Sciences.description: The building is home to Department of Animal and Food Sciences classrooms, research labs and administrative offices as well as COWamongus, a food service and retail store.

Architecture.label: Architecture
Architecture.description: The College of Architecture building opened in 1971. Architecture has been offered at Texas Tech since 1927. It became a full college in 1986.

Art.label: Art
Art.description: The building is home to the School of Art classrooms, studios labs and administrative offices and the Landmark Arts Gallery.

Art_3D.label: Art 3D
Art_3D.description: The Art 3-D annex is home to sculpture, jewelry design and metalsmithing classes in the School of Art.

Bayer_Plant_Science.label: Bayer Plant Science

links.label: Department of Plant & Soil Sciences Homepage

Bayer_Plant_Science.description: The Texas Tech University System Board of Regents in December 2013 approved a $13.6 million project to design and construct a new Plant & Soil Science Building and renovate the existing Plant Sciences Building. Eric Hequet, chairman of Tech's Department of Plant and Soil Science, said the new Bayer Plant Science Building project adds 21,122 square feet of new construction, and includes 2,440 square feet of renovation and exterior upgrades to the existing home of the university's Department of Plant and Soil Science. The building project is funded by donations to Texas Tech, including lead contributions from Bayer CropScience. The Department of Plant & Soil Science was formerly housed in the existing PSS, Food Technology and Agricultural Sciences buildings. Teaching and research labs, along with faculty and graduate students, that were located in other buildings have been relocated to the new wing. Additionally, departmental administration offices have been relocated to the new wing.

Biology.label: Biology
Biology.description: The building is home to the Department of Biological Sciences classrooms, research labs, administrative offices and the Biology Auditorium.

Biology_Auditorium.label: Biology Auditorium
Biology_Auditorium.description: Classroom space for the Department of Biological Sciences. Other campus lectures are held here.

Biology_Greenhouse.label: Biology Greenhouse
Biology_Greenhouse.description: The facility houses research projects as well as teaching materials for various Department of Biological Sciences classes.

Burkhart_Center_for_Autism_Education_and.label: Burkhart Center for Autism Education & Research
Burkhart_Center_for_Autism_Education_and.description: The Burkhart Center for Autism Education and Research, named for Jim and Jere Lynn Burkhart who have made significant contributions to the establishment and mission of the Center, officially opened in October of 2005.

Carpenter_Wells_Complex.label: Carpenter/Wells Complex
Carpenter_Wells_Complex.description:
The Carpenter/Wells Complex is a coed, suite-style residence hall, offering three-bedroom townhouses and four-bedroom flats along with a limited number of two-bedroom units available to men and women of sophomore or higher classification. The Leadership Development Center (LDC) serves as a commons building, featuring a computer lab and several study lounges. Other amenities include meeting rooms and limitless laundry rooms for all residents. Students share a suite with other students of the same gender.

Each suite includes a living room, kitchenette (refrigerator, microwave oven and two-burner cook-top), private bedrooms and two bathrooms. All suites have outside entrances.

Suite furnishings include a sofa, table and chair (living room); dining table and chairs; and each bedroom is furnished with a twin bed, dresser, study desk and chair. The bedrooms have vinyl wood-plank flooring. The kitchen and bathrooms have vinyl floors.

Charles_E._Maedgen_Jr._Theatre.label: Charles E. Maedgen Jr. Theatre
Charles_E._Maedgen_Jr._Theatre.description: The Charles E. Maedgen Jr. Theatre is home to the Department of Theatre and Dance. The main stage and adjoining lab theatre offer a variety of performances that are open to the public.

Chemical_Engineering.label: Chemical Engineering
Chemical_Engineering.description: The building houses the Department Chemical Engineering classrooms, research labs and administrative offices.

Chemistry.label: Chemistry
Chemistry.description: The building is home to the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry classrooms, research labs and administrative offices.

Child_Development_Research_Center.label: Child Development Research Center
Child_Development_Research_Center.description: A part of the College of Human Sciences, the facility houses programs and offices for the Early Childhood specialization in the Department of Human Development and Family Studies.

Chitwood_Weymouth_Residence_Hall.label: Chitwood/Weymouth Residence Hall
Chitwood_Weymouth_Residence_Hall.description: Chitwood/Weymouth Hall is a co-ed, built-in furniture residence hall. The First Year Success (FYS) Learning Community is located on the southwest side of campus near the College of Architecture and the Law School, and is only available to incoming freshman. Features of the hall include a TV lounge, and access to the new Chitwood/Weymouth Learning Center. Limitless laundry lounges are available for all residents.

Civil_Engineering.label: Civil Engineering
Civil_Engineering.description: The building houses the Department of Civil Engineering classrooms, research labs and administrative offices.

Classical_&_Modern_Languages_and_Literat.label: Classical & Modern Languages and Literatures
Classical_&_Modern_Languages_and_Literat.description: The building is home to the Department of Classical & Modern Languages & Literatures classrooms, labs and offices.

Coleman_Residence_Hall.label: Coleman Residence Hall
Coleman_Residence_Hall.description: Coleman Hall is a coed, built-in furniture residence hall. The Global TECHsans Learning Community is located in Coleman Hall on the southwest side of campus near the College of Architecture and the Law School. Men and women live on alternating floors. Features of the hall include a TV lounge, a computer lab, and several floor lounges. Limitless laundry lounges are available for all residents.

Computer_Science.label: Computer Science
Computer_Science.description: The Department of Computer Science engages in the research, education, and service activities required to create and disseminate the knowledge of problem solving using computers.

Creative_Movement_Studio.label: Creative Movement Studio
Creative_Movement_Studio.description: The Creative Movement Studio is a multi-purpose studio that houses the Dance & Theatre programs, including studio spaces for rehearsals, and the university's cheer and pom squads.

Dairy_Barn.label: Dairy Barn
Dairy_Barn.description: The Dairy Barn was one of the original campus structures. Abandoned in 1964, the Texas Antiquities Committee designated the barn as a historical landmark in 1985.

Dan_Law_Field_(Baseball)_at_Rip_Griffin_.label: Dan Law Field (Baseball) at Rip Griffin Park

links.label: Dan Law Field at Rip Griffin Park

Dan_Law_Field_(Baseball)_at_Rip_Griffin_.description: 'The Law' is home to the Texas Tech Red Raider baseball team and has a seating capacity over 4,000.

Development.label: Development
Development.description: The building is home to the Office of Institutional Advancement which oversees fundraising for the Texas Tech University System.

Doak_Conference_Center.label: Doak Conference Center
Doak_Conference_Center.description: The building houses various business offices of Texas Tech University.

Doak_Hall.label: Doak Hall
Doak_Hall.description: Currently Doak hall is home to individual programs under the Division of Institutional Diversity, Equity & Community Engagement

Don_&_Ethel_McLeod_Tennis_Center.label: Don & Ethel McLeod Tennis Center
Don_&_Ethel_McLeod_Tennis_Center.description: The Don and Ethel McLeod Tennis Center features 12 courts with spectator capabilities and, in fact, the facility has hosted several prestigious tennis events since its opening in time for the 2000 spring season.

Drane_Hall.label: Drane Hall
Drane_Hall.description: Drane Hall houses various business offices of Texas Tech University as well as administrative offices of the College of Visual and Performing Arts.

Education.label: Education
Education.description: The Education building opened in 2002. The building faces the English/Philosophy building across a large courtyard. The two buildings mirror each other in architectural design.

Engineering_&_Technology_Lab.label: Engineering & Technology Lab
Engineering_&_Technology_Lab.description: The building provides research lab and office space for the Whitacre College of Engineering.

Experimental_Sciences.label: Experimental Sciences

links.label: College of Agricultural Sciences & Natural Resources
Edward E. Whitacre Jr. College of Engineering

Experimental_Sciences.description: The building houses multi-discipline research laboratories and classrooms.

Fisheries_&_Wildlife_Research.label: Fisheries & Wildlife Research
Fisheries_&_Wildlife_Research.description: The building is home to Department of Natural Resources Management classrooms, research labs and offices.

Football_Training_Complex.label: Football Training Complex
Football_Training_Complex.description: The Athletic Complex, commonly known as the Football Training Complex or FTC, features training facilities and access to the outdoor football practice field.

Frazier_Alumni_Pavilion.label: Frazier Alumni Pavilion
Frazier_Alumni_Pavilion.description: Owned by the Texas Tech Alumni Association, the facility is used for a variety of meetings and events.

Goddard_Range_&_Wildlife_Management.label: Goddard Range & Wildlife Management
Goddard_Range_&_Wildlife_Management.description: The building is home to the Office of the Dean of the College of Agricultural Sciences and Natural Resources as well as classrooms and lab space.

Gordon_Bledsoe_Residence_Hall.label: Gordon/Bledsoe Residence Hall
Gordon_Bledsoe_Residence_Hall.description:
Gordon Hall is a coed, suite-style residence hall located on the northeast side of campus. Students in the hall share a suite with students of the same gender only. A furnished living room sits between two bedroom units. Each fully furnished bedroom unit accommodates one to two students and includes a vanity area and private bathroom.

Bledsoe Hall is a residence hall for men. It is home to the Engineering Success Learning Community.

Holden_Hall.label: Holden Hall
Holden_Hall.description: Holden Hall houses the College of Arts and Sciences administrative offices and classrooms. The original building features a 1,300 square-foot fresco mural by renowned painter Peter Hurd.

Honors_Residence_Hall.label: Honors Residential Hall
Honors_Residence_Hall.description: The honors residence hall is a co-ed, pod style residence hall with movable furniture. Rooms in the hall are clustered around a central community bathroom, with an additional nearby private bathroom. Study lounges are adjacent to the rooms to allow residents a place to study and meet other honors students. Additional features include a multi-purpose room for special group meetings and presentations, study lounges near each pod, a new 944 square foot Starbucks® which will accept dining bucks, and several large lounges, with the main lounge located on the first floor of the building.

Hulen_Clement_Residence_Hall.label: Hulen/Clement Residence Hall
Hulen_Clement_Residence_Hall.description: Hulen/Clement Hall is a coed, built-in furniture residence hall. The Architecture and Design Learning Community is located in Clement Hall, near the College of Architecture, English, Philosophy, and Education buildings. Men and women live on alternating floors. This residence hall offers lounges and study rooms for the convenience of residents. Special studio lounges are available to students in the Architecture and Design Learning Community. Limitless laundry lounges are available for all residents.

Human_Sciences.label: Human Sciences
Human_Sciences.description: The College of Human Sciences features programs ranging from family studies to financial planning to fashion design to the study of addiction of recovery.

Industrial,_Manufacturing,_&_Systems_Eng.label: Industrial, Mechanical & Systems Engineering
Industrial,_Manufacturing,_&_Systems_Eng.description: The building is home to the Department of Industrial, Manufacturing & Systems Engineering classrooms, labs and offices.

International_Cultural_Center.label: International Cultural Center
International_Cultural_Center.description: The International Cultural Center houses Texas Tech's Office of International Affairs and Study Abroad programs, as well as a U.S. passport office. The university offers a variety of educational opportunities in more than 70 countries worldwide.

J.T._&_Margaret_Talkington_Residence_Hal.label: J.T. and Margaret Talkington Residence Hall
J.T._&_Margaret_Talkington_Residence_Hal.description:
Talkington Hall is a coed, suite-style residence hall. A two-story, 20,500-square-foot dining facility, office, limitless laundry lounges, and meeting rooms are located in the complex. Students share a suite with students of the same gender.

Each suite has private bathrooms, a living area, and two or four bedrooms. Bedrooms are furnished with a twin bed, desk, and dresser. The shared living area in most suites is furnished with a sofa, entertainment center, coffee table, full-sized refrigerator, and a microwave oven. Some rooms may have lounge chairs instead of sofas, and not all spaces will have a coffee table. Each living room and bedroom has laminate wood flooring. Bathrooms have ceramic tile flooring and separate sink/vanity areas. Ceiling fans are included in each bedroom and the living area.

Jones_AT&T_Stadium_(Football).label: Jones AT&T Stadium (Football)
Jones_AT&T_Stadium_(Football).description: Jones AT&T Stadium, home of Red Raider football since Nov. 29, 1947, is arguably one of the most electric game day atmospheres in all of college football. Armed with 60,000-plus rabid fans, Dave Curtis of The Sporting News proclaimed in May of 2010 that Jones AT&T Stadium was the best home field advantage in all of college football.

Maddox_Engineering_Research_Center.label: Maddox Engineering Research Center
Maddox_Engineering_Research_Center.description: With research facilities for two National Academy of Engineering faculty, the Maddox Engineering Research Center enables the Whitacre College of Engineering to continue addressing global research challenges and collaborate with colleagues around the world.

Marsha_Sharp_Center_for_Student_Athletic.label: Marsha Sharp Center for Student Athletics
Marsha_Sharp_Center_for_Student_Athletic.description: The facility houses offices and facilities dedicated to the academic success of student athletes.

McClellan_Hall.label: McClellan Hall
McClellan_Hall.description: The building is the home of the Honors College administrative offices.

Meat_Lab_&_Livestock_Arena.label: Meat Lab & Livestock Arena
Meat_Lab_&_Livestock_Arena.description: The Meat Lab is home to research and teaching facilities. The Livestock arena is used for various animal classes and events.

Media_&_Communication.label: Media & Communication
Media_&_Communication.description: The Media & Communication building houses the College of    Media & Communication, the Department of Communication Studies, Army ROTC, Atmospheric Science, Texas Tech University Press and Student Media.

Murray_Residence_Hall.label: Murray Residence Hall
Murray_Residence_Hall.description:
Murray Hall is a coed, suite-style residence hall. The Business, Honors, and Terry Scholars learning communities are located in Murray Hall near several engineering buildings. Murray Hall is open year-round to provide residents a location where they may live continuously throughout their academic career. Students share a suite with students of the same gender only.

Each suite has private bathrooms, a living area and four bedrooms (a limited number of suites have three bedrooms). Bedrooms are furnished with a twin bed, desk and dresser. The shared living area is furnished with a sofa, entertainment center, coffee table, full-sized refrigerator, and a microwave oven. Bedrooms have vinyl flooring while the living area has laminate wood flooring. Bathrooms have ceramic tile flooring and separate sink/vanity areas. Ceiling fans are included in each bedroom and the living area.

Music.label: Music
Music.description: The facility houses School of Music classroom, performance and practice halls and offices.

PBS_Station_KTTZ.label: PBS Station KTTZ
PBS_Station_KTTZ.description: The facility houses the studios and offices of KTXT-TV, the Texas Tech owned Public Broadcasting Station in Lubbock.

Parking_Garage.label: Parking Garage
Parking_Garage.description: A multi-level parking garage for Texas Tech faculty, staff and students.

Physical_Plant.label: Physical Plant
Physical_Plant.description: Location of the Operations Division at Texas Tech.

Plant_Sciences_Greenhouse.label: Plant Sciences Greenhouse

links.label: Horticulture Gardens and Greenhouse Complex Homepage

Plant_Sciences_Greenhouse.description: The Texas Tech University Gardens and Greenhouse Complex is located just north of the United Supermarkets Arena. This facility provides teaching, research and engagement opportunities for the Department of Plant and Soil Science faculty and students as well as the local community.

Psychology.label: Psychology
Psychology.description: The facility is home to Department of Psychology classrooms, labs and offices.

Rec_Sports_Leisure_Pool.label: Rec Sports Leisure Pool
Rec_Sports_Leisure_Pool.description: The leisure pool opened in 2009 and features a lazy river, a 15-foot slide, and a hot tub that seats up to 20 people.

Robert_H._Ewalt_Student_Rec_Center.label: Robert H. Ewalt Student Rec Center
Robert_H._Ewalt_Student_Rec_Center.description: The Robert H. Ewalt Student Recreation Center features a raised jogging track, volleyball/basketball courts and weight room facilities. The climbing, outdoor pursuits and aquatic centers are also found here.

Sneed_Residence_Hall.label: Sneed Residence Hall
Sneed_Residence_Hall.description:
Sneed Hall is an all-male, movable furniture residence hall. The Men of STEM (Science Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) Learning Community is located in Sneed Hall near the College of Engineering, West Hall and Holden Hall.

Furnishings consist of extra-long twin beds, individual desks with chairs, chests of drawers, a sink, medicine cabinet with mirror, closets and a ceiling fan. All furniture is movable. Facilities available to residents include a large recently remodeled lobby which consists of an informal TV lounge. Limitless laundry lounges are available for all residents.

Sports_Performance_Center.label: Sports Performance Center
Sports_Performance_Center.description:
The new facility will also enable Texas Tech to host championship-level track and field events, including the Big 12 Conference Indoor Track and Field Championships. The facility will also build upon Texas Tech's service to the community as the university plans to continue to host numerous high school indoor track and field meets each year.

Beginning this January, the facility will host the nation's top track and field programs from across the country as Texas Tech will be among the few schools nationally to boast an indoor 200-meter banked track. Wes Kittley's track and field program will be able to host the premier collegiate events in the facility, including the Big 12 Indoor Championships as well as potentially the NCAA Championships.

Stangel_Murdough_Residence_Hall.label: Stangel/Murdough Residence Hall
Stangel_Murdough_Residence_Hall.description:
Stangel Hall is a coed, built-in furniture residence hall. The Health Sciences Learning Community is located in Stangel Hall on the central western edge of the main campus, near Agriculture row, Biology building, and Experimental Science buildings. Stangel Hall is coed by wing. A TV lounge, piano lounge, and several study lounges are located on the second and fourth floors. Limitless laundry lounges are available for all residents. The Stangel/Murdough Complex has two sand volleyball courts just south of the complex.

Murdough Hall is a coed, built-in furniture residence hall. The Media and Communication, First Gen, PreLaw, and the College of Agricultural Sciences and Natural Resources learning communities are located in Murdough Hall on the central western edge of the main campus near Agriculture row, Biology, and Experimental Science buildings. Murdough is coed by wing. A TV lounge, piano lounge and several study lounges are located on the second and fourth floors. Limitless laundry lounges are available for all residents. The Stangel/Murdough Complex has two sand volleyball courts on the south side of the complex.

Student_Union_Building.label: Student Union Building
Student_Union_Building.description: The Student Union Building houses a food court, Barnes & Noble Bookstore, Starbucks, the Allen Theatre, Student Government Association and work space for many of the more than 400 student organizations.

Student_Wellness_Center.label: Student Wellness Center
Student_Wellness_Center.description: The Student Wellness Center houses both Student Health Services and the Student Counseling Center. A pharmacy that offers student discounts is located in the building.

Terry_Fuller_Petroleum_Engineering_Resea.label: Terry Fuller Petroleum Engineering Research Building
Terry_Fuller_Petroleum_Engineering_Resea.description: The Terry Fuller Petroleum Engineering Research Building has approximately 42,000 square feet of modern classroom and research space and features a unique cluster of laboratories.

TTU_System_Administration_Building.label: TTU System Administration Building
TTU_System_Administration_Building.description: The Texas Tech University System Building is home to TTU System leadership, staff and personnel. The TTU System offices provide leadership and support service for its component institutions in the attainment of each university's individual mission.

United_Supermarkets_Arena.label: United Supermarkets Arena
United_Supermarkets_Arena.description: The 15,000 seat multi-purpose facility is home to Texas Tech basketball and volleyball. The arena also hosts concerts by some of the biggest names in music.

University_Library.label: University Library
University_Library.description: The University Library is the state's third largest library with nearly two million books and a myriad of electronic publications and databases.

Wall_Gates_Residence_Hall.label: Wall/Gates Residence Hall
Wall_Gates_Residence_Hall.description: Wall/Gates Hall is a coed, built-in furniture residence hall. The Fine Arts Learning Community is located on the south side of campus in Wall Hall and the Tech Transfer Acceleration Program (TTAP) Learning Communities are located on the south side of campus in Gates Hall, near the Charles E. Maedgen Jr. Theatre, Music building, and the Library. Men and women live on alternating floors at Wall/Gates Hall. A large lobby connects Wall Hall and Gates Hall. A study lounge and vending rooms are features of the Wall/Gates Complex. Limitless laundry lounges are available for all residents.

Weeks_Hall.label: Weeks Hall
Weeks_Hall.description: A former residence hall, the building is currently empty.

West_Hall.label: West Hall
West_Hall.description: The Visitor's Center, undergraduate admissions offices, the registrar's office, student business services and the scholarship and financial aid offices are here.

West_Village_A_Residence_Hall.label: West Village A Residence Hall
West_Village_A_Residence_Hall.description: The West Village is a coed, apartment-style residence hall offering one-bedroom, two-bedroom and four-bedroom units. Students over 21 years of age may live in West Village B (West Village Graduate), and students of sophomore or higher classification may live in West Village A (West Village Upperclass). Amenities include washers and dryers in the one-bedroom and two-bedroom apartments, and limitless laundry lounges with free WiFi for the four-bedroom apartments.

West_Village_B_Residence_Hall.label: West Village B Residence Hall
West_Village_B_Residence_Hall.description: The West Village is a coed, apartment-style residence hall offering one-bedroom, two-bedroom and four-bedroom units. Students over 21 years of age may live in West Village B (West Village Graduate), and students of sophomore or higher classification may live in West Village A (West Village Upperclass). Amenities include washers and dryers in the one-bedroom and two-bedroom apartments, and limitless laundry lounges with free WiFi for the four-bedroom apartments.

Wiggins_Complex.label: Wiggins Complex
Wiggins_Complex.description: The Wiggins Complex houses University Career Services, Student Housing, and Hospitality Services of Texas Tech University.
